tit.e: Imo-yokan (azuki-bean jelly containing sweet potato paste)
tit.cmt: Imo 大文字にしました。
tit.e: Imo-yokan (azuki-bean jelly containing sweet potato paste)

sen.j: 芋羊羹（いもようかん）は、サツマイモを主原料として練り上げ成型した和菓子である。
sen.e: Imo-yokan is a Japanese sweet having sweet potatoes as a main ingredient that is kneaded and molded
Imo-yokan is a Japanese sweet having sweet potatoes as a main ingredient that is kneaded and molded.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: Imo-yokan is a Japanese sweet having sweet potatoes as a main ingredient that is kneaded and molded.

sen.j: 芋を好む鯉釣りの餌にも利用される。
sen.e: It is used as a bait to catch a carp preferring potatoes.
It is used as a bait to catch a carp preferring potatoes.
It is used as a bait to catch a carp preferring potatoes.

sen.j: 釣り餌用の配合で作られた製品が釣具店で入手できる。
sen.e: A product made with combination for baits is available in fishing tackle shop (be careful that the product is not delicious for human beings because chrysalis powder is included in it.)
A product made with combination for baits is available in fishing tackle shop. (Be careful that the product is not delicious for human beings because chrysalis powder is included in it.)
sen.cmt: 2バイト文字を修正しました。
sen.e: A product made with combination for baits is available in fishing tackle shop.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: （サナギ粉などが入っており人間が食べても美味くないので注意）
sen.e: (Be careful that the product is not delicious for human beings because chrysalis powder is included in it.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 一般的な製法は次の通りである。
sen.e: A commonly used production method is as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A commonly used production method is as follows.
A commonly used production method is as follows.

sen.j: すなわち、サツマイモを蒸して熱いうちに砂糖を練り混ぜ、四角形の型に押し詰め、冷やし固める。
sen.e: That is, a sweet potato is steamed and then is kneaded and mixed with sugar while it is hot. Subsequently it is pushed into a box and then cooled to harden.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: That is, a sweet potato is steamed and then is kneaded and mixed with sugar while being hot, and subsequently it is pushed into a box and then cooled to harden.
That is, a sweet potato is steamed and then is kneaded and mixed with sugar while being hot, and subsequently it is pushed into a box and then cooled to harden.

sen.j: サツマイモを蒸す代わりに茹でたり、砂糖の他に少量の塩や寒天などを添加することもある。
sen.e: Sometimes a sweet potato is boiled instead of steaming, or a little salt or agar may be added other than sugar.
Sometimes a sweet potato is boiled instead of being steamed, or a little salt or agar may be added other than sugar.
Sometimes a sweet potato is boiled instead of being steamed, or a little salt or agar may be added other than sugar.

sen.j: 明治30年代前半、小林和助は浅草寿町（現在の東京都台東区寿 (台東区)）で芋問屋を営んでいた。
sen.e: In the first half of 30's in Meiji period, Wasuke KOBAYASHI was a potato wholesaler in Asakusa Kotobuki-cho (Kotobuki, Taito-ku, Tokyo.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the period from 1897 to 1902, Wasuke KOBAYASHI was a potato wholesaler in Asakusa Kotobuki-cho (present-day Kotobuki, Taito Ward, Tokyo).
sen.cmt: Taito Ward としました。明治30年代前半 →1897 ～1902としました。
sen.e: During the period from 1897 to 1902, Wasuke KOBAYASHI was a potato wholesaler in Asakusa Kotobuki-cho (present-day Kotobuki, Taito Ward, Tokyo).

sen.j: 処理に困っていたくず芋を有効利用するため、練り羊羹と一味異なった羊羹を造ろうとした。
sen.e: To make good use of the waste potato that was difficult to dispose, he tried to make yokan (azuki-bean jelly) with different taste from bean jelly made with agar and sugar.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: To make good use of the waste potatoes that were difficult to dispose, he tried to make yokan (azuki-bean jelly) with different taste from bean jelly made with agar and sugar.
To make good use of the waste potatoes that were difficult to dispose, he tried to make yokan (azuki-bean jelly) with different taste from bean jelly made with agar and sugar.

sen.j: 浅草の和菓子店「舟定」（創業）の二代目・定吉に持ちかけ、共同開発により「芋ようかん」を完成させた。
sen.e: He approached to the second generation Sadakichi of Japanese sweet shop "Funasada" in Asakusa, and then "imo-yokan" was completed by joint development.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He approached to Sadakichi, the second generation of Japanese sweet shop 'Funasada' in Asakusa, and then 'imo-yokan' was completed by joint development.
sen.cmt: 語順を一部変更しました。
sen.e: He approached to Sadakichi, the second generation of Japanese sweet shop 'Funasada' in Asakusa, and then 'imo-yokan' was completed by joint development.

sen.j: その後和助は、定吉のもとで芋羊羹の作り方を学んだ。
sen.e: Afterwards, Wasuke learned from Sadakichi how to make imo-yokan and trained for a skill worker.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, Wasuke learned from Sadakichi how to make imo-yokan.
sen.cmt: 文章を一部削除しました。
sen.e: Afterwards, Wasuke learned from Sadakichi how to make imo-yokan.

sen.j: 和菓子職人としての修行を積み、のれん分けにより独立。
sen.e: He became independent by setting up a branch of the same shop to share the clientele.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He trained to become a skilled artisan of Japanese sweets, and became independent by setting up a branch of the same shop to share the clientele.
sen.cmt: 前列にあった文章をこちらに結合しました。
sen.e: He trained to become a skilled artisan of Japanese sweets, and became independent by setting up a branch of the same shop to share the clientele.

sen.j: 和助は「舟定」と自分の名「和助」から一文字ずつをとり、浅草一丁目に「舟和」を創業した。
sen.e: Wasuke founded "Funawa" in Asakusa 1-chome, the name of which was made by taking one character from each of "Funhasada" and "Wasuke."
Wasuke founded 'Funawa' in Asakusa 1-chome, the name of which was made by taking one character from each of 'Funasada' and 'Wasuke.'
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Wasuke founded 'Funawa' in Asakusa 1-chome, the name of which was made by taking one character from each of 'Funasada' and 'Wasuke.'

sen.j: なお、定吉と和助が「舟」の字を用いたのは、二人が共に船橋町（現在の千葉県船橋市）出身であったことに由来する。
sen.e: In addition, Sadakichi and Wasuke used a character of "Fune" because two came from Funabashicho (Funabashi-shi, Chiba.)
In addition, Sadakichi and Wasuke used a character of 'Fune' because two came from Funabashi-cho (the current Funabashi City, Chiba Prefecture).
In addition, Sadakichi and Wasuke used a character of 'Fune' because two came from Funabashi-cho (the current Funabashi City, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: その後定吉は家族と共に足利町（現在の栃木県足利市）に移り住み、「舟定」は足利に移転した。
sen.e: Then, Sadakichi moves to Ashikaga-cho (Ashikagashi, Tochigi) with his family, and thus "Funasada" moved to Ashikaga.
Then, Sadakichi moved to Ashikaga-cho (present-day Ashikaga City, Tochigi Prefecture) with his family, and thus 'Funasada' moved to Ashikaga.
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。prefecture を追加しました。
sen.e: Then, Sadakichi moved to Ashikaga-cho (present-day Ashikaga City, Tochigi Prefecture) with his family, and thus 'Funasada' moved to Ashikaga.

sen.j: 現在では芋羊羹は日本全国に広まっており、埼玉県川越市などのサツマイモ産地の名産品としても親しまれている。
sen.e: Nowadays, Imo-yokan has spread all over Japan, and is familiar as a special product of sweet potato production areas such as Kawagoeshi, Saitama.
Nowadays, imo-yokan has spread all over Japan, and is familiar as a special product of sweet potato production areas such as Kawagoe City, Saitama Prefecture.
Nowadays, imo-yokan has spread all over Japan, and is familiar as a special product of sweet potato production areas such as Kawagoe City, Saitama Prefecture.
